tables.title: Mesh Chatter
tables.description: Gossip pulsing through message boards, barbacks, and ride-share drivers.

entries.result: A courier vanished while hauling a prototype biochip coded to reject corporate firmware.
Someone painted over a corp billboard with coordinates; drones keep cleaning it and it reappears nightly.
A gang lieutenant woke up missing cyberarms they never purchased, with serials filed off.
A laundromat's loyalty app has a hidden chatroom filled with insider trading tips.
A netradio DJ claims to broadcast from a moving train no scanner can tag.
A rogue AI trades rare music files for samples of people's dreams.
A neighborhood grid node pings
emergency
every dusk but no responders show.
A synthfood brand supposedly hides sedatives in batches bound for one district.
Old subway tunnels reopened; graffiti there matches encrypted corp project names.
Someone is paying edgerunners in art NFTs that unlock physical caches in vending machines.

tables.title: District Vignettes
tables.description: Sensory snapshots that define each block and its quirks.

entries.result: Laundry drones zip between buildings while neon tarps turn alleys into color-splashed canyons.
A monorail passes overhead, casting rolling shadows across street murals of forgotten activists.
Vape clouds mix with incense from a micro-temple built in an abandoned ATM kiosk.
A street doc's tent glows surgical blue under a freeway overpass.
AR mascots from competing stores glitch-fight midair, tossing pixel sparks.
Residents string solar lanterns from fire escapes to guide delivery drones.
An open-air VR parlor spills laughter as players dodge invisible obstacles.
Dumpster-diving kids race hacked smart-bikes through an alley obstacle course.
An abandoned corporate lobby is now a night market of soldering irons and synth-spice.
Holo-billboards sync to the beat from a rooftop DJ, advertising crews dancing below.
Power cables hang low enough to spark against passing trucks, drawing cheers when they flare.
A shrine of broken cyberlimbs honors victims of a recent crackdown.

tables.title: Underground Vendors
tables.description: Merchandise and favors available if you know who to ask.

entries.result: A street tailor who weaves ballistic fibers into any jacket while you wait.
A gene-hacker selling temporary scent profiles that spoof biometric locks.
A weaponsmith offering EMP flechettes salvaged from naval stockpiles.
A drone chop-shop swapping serial plates and providing fake flight plans.
A medtech delivering black-market stim patches with unpredictable side effects.
A codec dealer who rents one-time-use encryption suites for heists.
A retired corp hacker selling access to a forgotten maintenance subnet.
A smuggler trading in pre-crash music players that are immune to modern tracking.
A fixer with maps of sewer drones and their nightly routes.
A cybervet who fits animal companions with stealth modding for courier jobs.

tables.title: Corporate Countermeasures
tables.description: How megacorps respond when operations are threatened.

entries.result: Deploys a polite liaison offering a contract buyoutâ€”sign now or else.
Floods the block with branded pop-up clinics to mine health data.
Hijacks local news feeds to spin the crew as dangerous hackers.
Sends a clean-up team with nonlethal foam rounds and drones recording everything.
Offers double pay to any rival crew willing to disrupt the job.
Triggers a micro-blackout to reboot all public sensors and wipe feeds.
Activates sleeper agents within a local gang to shift alliances.
Locks down transit nodes, forcing evac through monitored skyways.

tables.title: Intrusion Side-Effects
tables.description: Digital weirdness that bleeds into the physical during deep dives.

entries.result: AR overlays desynchronize, showing two conflicting realities at once.
The runner's voice modulates with autotune echoes when lying.
Nearby vending machines spit out obsolete coins stamped with deleted corp logos.
Streetlights pulse in Morse code matching the target server's heartbeat.
A phantom alert keeps pinging a squad of corporate security two blocks away.
A ghost avatar appears in reflective surfaces, gesturing toward a hidden exit node.
